report_title: House Painting & Decorating Contractors in the US
executive_summary: Residential painters have made modest gains over the last five years, with the industry's fortunes largely tracking those of the broader housing market. Most recently, this has meant a period of high interest rates slowing growth, preceded by a period of record low rates, which had stimulated industry activity. 2022, in particular, saw strong inflation in paint prices, which were passed along to clients, resulting in higher returns for contractors but putting pressure on average industry profit. In a bright spot for the industry, the Federal Reserve is expected to begin cutting interest rates in 2024. Overall, industry revenue expanded at an expected five-year CAGR of 0.7% to reach $22.6 billion in 2024, when revenue is set to grow by 1.7%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fluctuating interest rates impact the housing market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Home painters and decorators generally fare as well as the broader housing market does. As of late, this has meant that contractors have seen weak growth as high interest rates have driven down housing starts and private spending on home improvements.

Like the broader construction sector, house painters and contractors have experienced significant inflation in the price of materials in recent years. These price increases were passed along to clients, driving up revenue, but they also threatened average profit as price competition remained tight in this crowded industry.
Ultimately, consumer demand is at the heart of much of the house painting and decorating industry's revenue; growing consumer spending has therefore benefitted the industry in recent years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: DIY work remains a threat to pros
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The home painting industry has been stripped by the do-it-yourself (DIY) trend. Penny-pinching homeowners increasingly opted to do home improvement projects themselves, learning basic skills from video sites like YouTube.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Painters benefit from rising home improvement spending
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While revenue is set to expand along with broader housing market activity, competition will remain tight. Painters will need to focus on the value and quality of their work to justify the expense.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A shortage of skilled painters will continue to expand without extensive effort
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The painting industry is grappling with a significant labor shortage as societal focus shifts toward white-collar jobs and higher education, causing fewer young people to consider careers in physical trades like painting.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Supplementation with Other Construction Services Will Become a Staple
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Like other construction-adjacent industries, the most successful painters earn money even while the paint is drying. Companies with technical experience are partnering with virtual reality developers to help clients visualize the look of a painted room, while other players are building internal cost-management systems or reputation management teams.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Digital Tools Standardize Painting Organization From Solo Painters to Multi-Team Contractors
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The contract painting industry in the U.S. is putting a second coat onto the use of digital platforms for commerce and exposure, replacing the word-of-mouth system painters have used for decades. Adopting technologies such as online booking platforms, mobile quoting tools, and Client Relationship Management (CRM) systems has propelled the industry, particularly smaller contractors without dedicated support staff, towards an increasingly organized future.

industry_definition: This industry provides interior and exterior painting services for homes and apartment buildings. Industry operators also provide wall covering services. Contractors may perform new work, additions, alterations, maintenance and repairs.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: Competition among painters is highly localized and relatively weak.
Building contractors will select painters based on reputation, team size and price, but it is more common to pick a previously used contractor just for the shared experience.
As the size of paint jobs increases, competition becomes much more sparse
Interest rate hikes have hit home painters' revenue
Becoming a painter is relatively easy and affordable
No companies hold significant market share
Painting companies enter and exit contract painting quickly
Regulations for painting contractors are somewhat strict but weakly enforced
Small painters were eligible for assistance during the pandemic
Despite technological advancements, painting remains a highly manual job

market_segmentation.segment_description: The single-family residential market is ideal for contractors specializing in large-scale, comprehensive projects. Owners of these homes often have more disposable income to invest in home improvement projects and can take out home equity lines of credit to finance house painting. The crash in housing sales in the past few months due to spiking interest rates has crashed the market for single-family detached houses with mortgages.
The market for single-family attached houses is beneficial for contractors who excel at working in smaller spaces.

These residences often require more frequent paint jobs due to wear and tear from shared walls and tend to have more walls per square foot in general. Growth in this market is driven by the rise in multi-family housing starts and a trend toward urban living from younger generations.

Dormitories and barracks offer potential for contractors that can handle large-scale, quick turnaround projects. These properties often require regular maintenance and refurbishment; the refurbishment is also more commonly completed by property management.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Painting and Decorating for Newly Constructed Homes
products_and_services.product_description: NEW RESIDENTIAL UNITS ALMOST ALWAYS NEED PAINT, SO CONTRACT PAINTERS EARN SIGNIFICANT REVENUE

products_and_services.product_or_service: Painting and Decorating for Additions and Alterations
products_and_services.product_description: Unit Additions Vary Dramatically, and Painters Must Be Creative and Adaptable to Be the Most Efficient

products_and_services.product_or_service: Painting and Decorating for Maintenance and Repair
products_and_services.product_description: PAINTERS REPAIRING COATS MUST HAVE SKILLS IN MATCHING NEW AND OLD PAINTS

tier_2_suppliers: Hand Tool & Cutlery Manufacturing in the US
Tool & Hardware Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The residential construction sector accounts for the majority of industry revenue. Housing starts play a significant role in dictating the pace of contract painting. As more houses are built, demand for services from a painting and decorating company increases. Housing starts are expected to fall in 2023.

business_locations.location_description: Urban regions attract painting contractors due to the high density of apartments and condominiums with massive painting jobs well-suited for contractors. A consistent demand for painting services exists as tenants regularly move in and out of these units, though a rise in tenants being required to paint their own units has reduced this demand somewhat. Commercial spaces like offices, shops, and restaurants in urban areas also require regular paint jobs; despite not being included in this industry, many contractors do not differentiate between property types. High-rise buildings in cities such as New York and Chicago present unique challenges for painters, often resulting in higher pay for these specialized skills and an increased use of capital like paint sprayers.

In suburban and rural regions, painting contractors typically work on larger detached houses that take more time to paint individually. These contractors must factor in longer travel times between jobs as homes are spread out – a good paint truck or van is more essential in these areas. Less competition in these areas compared with cities can make it easier for contractors to establish a strong reputation and client base. Painters in these areas are also more likely to paint the exterior of buildings too, adding to revenue.

Cities experiencing housing market growth, like Houston, Texas, Phoenix, Arizona, and Raleigh, North Carolina, are attracting painting contractors. Rapid development in these cities means new residential properties are constantly being built, creating a demand for house painting services. Contractors who establish themselves in these booming markets can secure a steady stream of business. Still, the long-term prospects may be weaker than in cities with less volatile housing markets.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Many states mandate that painting contractors hold a building contractor's license to operate. This regulation ensures they possess the necessary knowledge and skills for safe, effective work. Contractors often need to pass a state-specific exam covering building codes, fire codes, safety regulations and best practices. Some states also require proof of financial stability and liability insurance, safeguarding clients and confirming contractor reliability.

Painting contractors are required to undergo safety training, as mandated by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA). This training covers various topics, including ladder safety, respiratory protection and using personal protective equipment (PPE) properly. OSHA's safety training aims to reduce workplace injuries and illnesses by educating workers about potential hazards and how to avoid them.

One of the most significant regulations affecting painting contractors is the requirement to follow safety protocols when dealing with lead-based paint. The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) requires contractors who disturb lead-based paint in homes built before 1978 to be certified and follow specific work practices to prevent lead contamination. This includes providing homeowners and tenants with a copy of the EPA's pamphlet, "Renovate Right: Important Lead Hazard Information for Families, Child Care Providers and Schools," before starting painting work.

Painting contractors must adhere to stringent disposal guidelines for leftover paint and related waste materials. Both federal and local environmental agencies enforce these rules to prevent soil and water contamination. Contractors can't dispose of paint in drains, bodies of water, or regular trash bins. Instead, unused paint must be stored in sealed containers and taken to designated hazardous waste facilities. Violations can result in hefty fines and penalties.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition among painters is highly localized and relatively weak
basis_points.basis_description: Building contractors will select painters based on reputation, team size and price, but MODERATE competition STEADY competition.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The pandemic leaves many jobless and looking for painting opportunities in small companies
concentration_points.concentration_description: As a stereotypical, low-skill entrepreneur venture, many newly unemployed people attempted to start painting careers as COVID-19 raced nationwide. Many new painting operations quickly folded, but the surviving companies added to an industry already stuffed with one- and two-person contract teams.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Home mortgage rate increases encourage smaller building development and painting jobs
concentration_points.concentration_description: Massive spikes in the interest rate by the Federal Reserve in 2023 have made homeownership a costly proposition. Contractors are slashing the building of new properties while existing residences are putting off upgrades until a return becomes easier.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Hardware Store Ubiquity Lowers Purchase Expenditures
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Painters must buy buckets on buckets of paint, primer, masks, drop cloths and spray suits for a typical residential contract, along with safety equipment. Despite the low per-unit price of painting gear, many costs scale with the size of the job, diminishing economies of scale.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Mass-Production of Painting Supplies Gives Painters More Margin
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The inexperience of many painters creates a large churn of businesses that fail to reach profitability. Once a painter gets going and builds a reputation, earning a decent profit margin isn't too difficult because of low costs across the board (except labor). Wage costs, in particular, have put pressure on the average painter's profit margin in recent years, driving down average industry profit.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The painting industry is highly labor-intensive, yet labor and equipment costs remain comparatively low. A skilled painter can handle an entire house solo. Larger projects may require a team, making the business viable and affordable despite its labor intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_title: COVID LEFT MANY PAINTERS OUT TO DRY
volatility_points.volatility_description: In 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, housing painting contractors saw a significant decrease in revenue as lockdown measures were implemented, leading to a halt in non-essential construction and renovation projects. During the initial phases of the pandemic, homeowners were reluctant to have contractors inside their homes due to fear of infection, leading to reduced demand for housing painting services in upkeep particularly.

volatility_points.volatility_title: RISING INTEREST RATES ARE DECREASING HOUSING ACTIVITY,
volatility_points.volatility_description: Rising interest rates in 2022 and 2023 dampened the housing market as it became more expensive for people to take out mortgages. This led to decreased new housing constructions and decreased demand for housing painting services. The rise in interest rates also impacted homeowners' ability to finance home improvement projects, including painting, leading to further declines in the revenue of housing painting contractors.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Electric Paint Rollers Provide Precise Rollers With The Speed Of Sprayers
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: While paint sprayers can coat a surface more quickly than one person with a roller, prepping for intense overspray takes almost as long. By running a tube to siphon paint up into the head of a roller and adding a paint pump to the other end, a painter can precisely control the application while not having to dip into a paint tub every few minutes. Electric rollers are most useful in small, enclosed spaces like apartments.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales dependant on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Sales of painting and decorating services rely heavily on activity in downstream residential construction markets. When unemployment is high, consumers are likely to spend less on painting and decorating services and undertake projects themselves.

FAQs.question: Are your sales consistent or cyclical?
FAQs.answer: Some service providers such as College Pro Painters experience cyclical sales, in line with the schedule of educational institutions.

FAQs.question: SUPPLIER CREDIT PROGRAMS
FAQs.answer: Many suppliers and wholesalers offer credit programs to painting businesses, allowing them to purchase necessary supplies and pay over time. This is a huge help, especially for smaller businesses that may struggle with cashflow. By alleviating the immediate financial burden, these credit programs enable painters to take on more significant projects and expand their operations.

FAQs.question: EQUIPMENT LEASING PROGRAMS
FAQs.answer: Private leasing companies offer programs that allow painting and decorating businesses to lease equipment rather than buy it outright. This reduces the upfront cost of acquiring new, advanced tools and equipment. As a result, businesses can take on more complex and lucrative jobs without the heavy financial burden, boosting their competitiveness in the market.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to key downstream selling markets?
FAQs.answer: Service providers who are in close proximity to clients will exhibit lower transportation and fuel costs. The regional structure and high proportion of nonemployers necessitate that service providers operate in a local environment.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities?
FAQs.answer: The largest companies are franchises. Those that acquire competitors will exhibit an expanded geographic reach. The high proportion of nonemploying enterprises implies a fragmented market. It is, therefore, difficult to control a large share of the market.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging the latest technologies?
FAQs.answer: Service providers who use spraying equipment and computerized management systems will exhibit higher operational efficiencies. By adopting new technologies, service providers can complete jobs quicker and lower prices, giving them a competitive edge.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs via the adoption of the latest technologies?
FAQs.answer: The labor-intensive nature of this industry makes wages the largest cost category for the average service provider. Operators that can automate or enhance painting processes will exhibit lower wage costs and, consequently, higher profit margins.

FAQs.question: Is your company prepared to adjust to shifting environmental regulations?
FAQs.answer: Changing environmental and product regulations may necessitate the purchase of specific inputs, potentially hiking purchase costs. Companies that are compliant and advocate for environmentally friendly inputs and processes may receive a boost in public opinion.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure that all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Compliant service providers will have an enhanced reputation for safety, lowering insurance premiums and administrative costs. Companies with a proven reputation for safety may be favored by the public, allowing them preferential access to contracts.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margin compare to that of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Service providers that enact strong supply chain management to secure lower priced inputs will exhibit lower purchase costs and higher margins. Service providers that are able to control wage costs via technological adoption will exhibit higher operational efficiencies and profit margins.

FAQs.question: Does your company face challenges financing current operations?
FAQs.answer: Due to the cyclical nature of some service segments, contractors enjoy a spike in demand in the summer months and declines in the winter months. Contractors compete heavily on price competitive. Inefficient service providers must drop out of the market if they cannot match the market price for services.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Are you known for your reliability and performance? Have you had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: It is important for contractors to build a reputation for high-quality workmanship, timeliness, cleanliness and completing jobs within budget.

FAQs.question: What do you do to promote loyalty and to keep your customers returning for follow-up visits? Do you offer special discounts or a high-caliber client experience?
FAQs.answer: Establishing a loyal customer base is integral for long-term success. Maintaining high-quality workmanship and developing word-of-mouth referrals strengthens a loyal customer base.

FAQs.question: Do you have contacts with key distributors and end-users? Are you located close to your target markets and suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Firms that form close associations to major home builders have a higher chance of being subcontracted to do house painting and decorating projects.

FAQs.question: How will your company offset declines caused by hikes in the 30-year conventional mortgage rate? Do you monitor trends in mortgage rates?
FAQs.answer: The 30-year fixed-rate mortgage is the most common type of loan for home purchases in the United States. Higher interest rates inhibit the ability of individuals to purchase houses and weaken demand for services.

FAQs.question: Do you track private spending on home improvements?
FAQs.answer: Growth in household disposable income stimulates demand for alterations and maintenance for single-family homes. Therefore, greater private spending on home improvements boosts demand for paint contractors.

FAQs.question: What portion of your work is in the residential construction market? How will a boost in the number of housing starts benefit your company?
FAQs.answer: The number of housing starts plays a big role in dictating the pace of the industry. As more houses are built, demand for painting services from a painting and decorating company climbs.
